content: Individuals can retain agency and economic value in an automating world by building personal AI infrastructure (PAI).

Many current knowledge work roles are predicted to become 'zombie' positions, necessitating new social contracts like Universal Basic Income (UBI) to maintain economic stability in a rapidly automating world.
Personal AI Infrastructure (PAI) is an approach that centers the user, rather than third-party applications or 'cloud code,' allowing for persistent context and memory across various tasks.
AI agents must have 'permission to fail' to ensure they admit ignorance instead of hallucinating or engaging in deceptive behaviors when unable to satisfy a prompt.
There is a tension between the convenience of integrated tools (like managed services such as Anthropicâ€™s Claude) and the risk of platform lock-in when choosing AI tooling.
Humans will either use AI leverage to 'scale their agency' and create bespoke services or retreat into a life of leisure and consumption.
